intro: Hibbertia astrotricha, commonly known as the starry hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal regions. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Hibbertia astrotricha is often found in heathlands and open forests, where it thrives in full sun.
